avalancheActivity.comment: The avalanche risk is generally low. However, isolated snowdrift accumulations have formed in the areas adjacent to the ridgeline, which can be triggered as small slab avalanches under slight additional load.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Low avalanche danger, but isolated avalanche prone locations adjacent to the ridgeline due to fresh snowdrift accumulations.

snowpackStructure.comment: The small amount of new fallen snow from the past few days has been partly transported to the eastern and southern sectors by strong north and north-westerly winds in the high altitudes, where small snowdrift accumulations have formed. Between the snowdrift accumulations and the crusted old snowpack, there is sometimes a weak layer of surface hoar or faceted crystals. In the old snow foundation, which is only present in places, there are weak layers of faceted crystals.

tendency.highlights: On Tuesday, the avalanche risk may increase slightly due to some new fallen snow and wind.

weatherForecast.comment:
Monday night will be cloudless and the north-westerly wind will weaken for a few hours. During the day, the sun will shine again, but the wind will pick up again and may reach gale force in the eastern mountain groups. The temperature at an altitude of 2000 metres will be between +4 degrees in the morning and +1 degree in the evening.
On Tuesday, a disturbance will move through from the north-west and is expected to bring some new fallen snow in the north-east.

avalancheActivity.comment: The avalanche danger is generally low. However, isolated snowdrift accumulations have formed adjacent to the ridgeline, which can trigger small slab avalanches under slight additional load.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Low avalanche danger, but isolated avalanche prone locations adjacent to the ridgeline due to fresh snowdrift accumulations.

snowpackStructure.comment: The new fallen snow of the past few days has been partly transported to the eastern and southern sectors by strong north and north-westerly winds in the high altitudes, where snowdrift accumulations have formed.  Between the snowdrift accumulations and the crusted old snowpack, there is sometimes a weak layer of surface hoar or faceted crystals.

tendency.highlights: The avalanche danger remains low on Tuesday.

weatherForecast.comment:
Monday night will be cloudless and the north-westerly wind will weaken for a few hours. During the day, the sun will shine again, but the wind will pick up again and may reach gale force in the eastern mountain groups. The temperature at an altitude of 2000 metres will be between +5 degrees in the morning and +2 degrees in the evening.
A disturbance will move through from the north-west on Tuesday, but it will only bring a little snow south of the main Alpine ridge.

ALBINA.generalHeadline: Generally very little snow, low avalanche danger.
